parameters.pythonCode:
# Loop over input items and add a new field called 'myNewField' to the JSON of each one
from urllib.parse import urlparse, urlunparse
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup


html = _input.all()[0]['json']['data']
soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')

job_links = soup.select('ul.jobs-search__results-list li div a[class*="base-card"]')



job_urls = []
for a_tag in job_links:
    href = a_tag.get('href')
    if href:

        parsed = urlparse(href)
        parsed_new = parsed._replace(netloc="www.linkedin.com")
        new_url = urlunparse(parsed_new)
        job_urls.append(new_url)




return {"links": job_urls}

from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import re

html = _input.all()[0]['json']['data']
soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')

# Security clearance and citizenship keywords to filter out
clearance_keywords = [
    'security clearance', 'clearance required', 'clearance eligible',
    'top secret', 'ts clearance', 'secret clearance', 'ts/sci',
    'polygraph', 'poly', 'dod clearance', 'government clearance',
    'active clearance', 'current clearance', 'must have clearance',
    'us citizen', 'u.s. citizen', 'us citizenship', 'u.s. citizenship',
    'green card', 'permanent resident', 'citizenship required', 'must be us citizen', 'us persons only'
]

try:
    title = soup.select('div h1')[0].text
    
    # Try to get company name, skip if unable to extract
    company_elements = soup.select('div span a')
    if not company_elements:
        return [{"continue": True}]   # unable to get company name Ã¢â€ ' skip
    
    company = company_elements[0].text.strip()
    if not company:  # if company name is empty after stripping
        return [{"continue": True}]   # unable to get company name Ã¢â€ ' skip
    
    # If company is in skip list Ã¢â€ ' act like "continue"
    if company.lower() in ["jobright.ai", "lensa", "jobs via dice","mercor","Robert Half"]:
        return [{"continue": True}]   # marker object
    
    location = soup.select("div span[class*='topcard__flavor topcard__flavor--bullet']")[0].text.strip()
    
    jd_container = soup.find("div", class_="description__text description__text--rich")
    complete_jd = jd_container.get_text(separator="\n", strip=True) if jd_container else "no jd"
    
    # Check for security clearance or citizenship requirements - same pattern as company filter
    if any(keyword in complete_jd.lower() for keyword in clearance_keywords):
        return [{"continue": True}]   # skip jobs with clearance/citizenship requirements
    
    urns = [a.get("data-semaphore-content-urn") for a in soup.select("a[data-item-type='semaphore']")]
    if not urns or not urns[0]:
        return [{"continue": True}]   # no job id Ã¢â€ ' skip like continue
    
    job_id = urns[0].split(":")[-1]
    apply_link = "https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/" + job_id
    
    return [{
        "title": title,
        "company": company,
        "location": location,
        "jd": complete_jd,
        "link": apply_link,
        "continue": False
    }]
except Exception as e:
    return [{"continue": True, "error": str(e)}]

assignments.name: resume
assignments.value: Eswar Sai Korrapati Open To Relocate | 551-344-5356 | eksai0726@gmail.com | https://www.linkedin.com/in/eswarsaikorrapati/ | https://github.com/ek-sai | https://eswarsaiportfolio.org/ | Professional Summary: Results-driven Software engineer having 3 years of experience with deep expertise in building and deploying scalable ML models using MLflow, SageMaker, and DVC. Skilled in designing end-to-end ML pipelines, enabling reproducibility and automation with MLOps frameworks. Strong experience integrating LLMs via OpenAI API, building transformer-based NLP models, and deploying explainable AI systems with SHAP/LIME. Adept at optimizing model performance, orchestrating workflows with Airflow, and managing large-scale data processing using Spark and AWS. Professional Experience: Software Engineer - AI/ML Comcast, San Jose, CA Aug 2024 - Present. Designed and deployed production-grade ML models using TensorFlow and PyTorch, improving prediction accuracy by 20% in real-time streaming systems. Built reproducible ML workflows using Apache Airflow, MLflow, and DVC, enabling versioned pipelines and consistent experiment tracking. Deployed models using AWS SageMaker and Lambda, cutting infrastructure costs by 15% and reducing deployment time by 35%. Applied SHAP and LIME to create explainability dashboards, aiding stakeholders in data-driven decision-making and regulatory compliance. Automated hyperparameter tuning using SageMaker Autopilot and Optuna, leading to an 18% improvement in model F1 score. Built scalable batch inference pipelines with Apache Spark and AWS S3, reducing inference time by 25% across large datasets. Integrated LLM-based chat capabilities using OpenAI API and prompt engineering, enhancing customer support response automation. Collaborated in Agile teams using Git, Docker, and Jenkins to streamline CI/CD across ML development lifecycles. Stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, MLflow, SageMaker, DVC, Airflow, OpenAI API, Spark, AWS (S3, Lambda, CloudWatch), Docker, Git, Optuna, SHAP, LIME. Software Engineer Dentsu, Hyderabad, India May 2020 - Jul 2022. Engineered RESTful APIs and backend logic using Django and Flask, increasing system throughput and API response efficiency. Developed automated ML workflows using Apache Airflow, improving pipeline reliability and scheduling across data ingestion tasks. Containerized and deployed web services via Docker and AWS EC2, achieving high availability and faster deployment cycles. Built a centralized Feature Store to standardize feature reuse across models, improving experimentation speed and consistency. Leveraged AutoML tools for ad campaign forecasting, reducing manual tuning time by 40% and improving prediction accuracy. Integrated model evaluation metrics (AUC, Precision, Recall, F1 Score) and visualization tools like Tableau to enhance stakeholder reporting. Managed cloud resources using AWS, automated deployments with Jenkins, and versioned projects via Git and GitHub Actions. Stack: Python, Flask, Django, SQL, MongoDB, AutoML, Airflow, Feature Store, Docker, Jenkins, Git, AWS EC2, Tableau. Education: M.S. in Computer Science Montclair State University, NJ Graduated: May 2024 | GPA: 3.65. Projects: RAG-based PDF Summarizer Built a PDF summarization tool using LangChain, OpenAI API, and FAISS for retrieval-augmented generation. Deployed using Streamlit, supporting semantic search, chunking, and real-time user interaction. Next Word Prediction with BERT Fine-tuned a BERT transformer model using PyTorch, achieving 92% top-5 prediction accuracy. Machine Transliteration Designed and implemented a custom encoder-decoder model using PyTorch for sequence-to-sequence tasks, supporting variable-length inputs and outputs. Technical Skills: Programming Languages: Python, C++, SQL, JavaScript. AI/ML & NLP: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras, BERT, Transformers, GPT, Hugging Face, LangChain, LangGraph. MLOps & Deployment: MLflow, SageMaker, DVC, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Feature Store, Jenkins. Explainability & Evaluation: SHAP, LIME, AUC, Precision, Recall, F1 Score, Confusion Matrix. Cloud & DevOps: AWS (S3, EC2, Lambda, SageMaker, CloudWatch), GitHub Actions. Data & Processing: Apache Spark, Pandas, NumPy, MongoDB, MySQL, Tableau. LLMs & APIs: OpenAI API, Prompt Engineering, LangChain, FastAPI, REST APIs. Tools & Collaboration: Git, Jupyter, Streamlit, Agile, IntelliJ, VS Code. Core CS: Data Structures and Algorithms

parameters.query: SELECT id FROM companies WHERE name = $1
INSERT INTO companies (name, domain) VALUES ($1, $2) ON CONFLICT (name) DO UPDATE SET domain = $2 RETURNING id
SELECT id FROM jobs WHERE job_url = $1
INSERT INTO jobs (company_id, title, location, job_url, linkedin_job_id, job_description, match_score, status) VALUES ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, 'scored') RETURNING id

options.queryReplacement: ={{ $('2_Insert Company').item.json.id }},{{ $('Company Filter').item.json.title }},{{ $('Company Filter').item.json.location }},{{ $('Company Filter').item.json.link }},{{ $('Company Filter').item.json.link.split('/').pop() }},{{ $('Company Filter').item.json.jd }},{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.job_match_score }}

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  COALESCE(ec.id, NULL) as id,
  COALESCE(ec.email, $1) as email,
  COALESCE(ec.contact_count, 0) as contact_count,
  COALESCE(ec.last_contacted, NULL) as last_contacted,
  COALESCE(ec.response_count, 0) as response_count,
  CASE 
    WHEN ec.last_contacted IS NULL THEN 999::INTEGER 
    ELSE EXTRACT(DAY FROM NOW() - ec.last_contacted)::INTEGER 
  END as days_since_last_contact,
  CASE 
    WHEN ec.response_count > 0 THEN (ec.response_count::float / ec.contact_count) 
    ELSE 0 
  END as response_rate
FROM email_contacts ec 
WHERE ec.email = $1 AND ec.company_id = $2
UNION ALL
SELECT 
  NULL as id, 
  $1 as email, 
  0 as contact_count, 
  NULL as last_contacted, 
  0 as response_count, 
  999 as days_since_last_contact, 
  0 as response_rate
WHERE NOT EXISTS (
  SELECT 1 FROM email_contacts WHERE email = $1 AND company_id = $2
)
LIMIT 1;
INSERT INTO email_contacts (company_id, email, confidence_score, source) VALUES ($1, $2, $3, $4) ON CONFLICT (company_id, email) DO UPDATE SET confidence_score = $3 RETURNING id

values.content:
=Main Prompt:
You are an expert recruiter outreach specialist. Craft a personalized, compelling email that will get a recruiter's attention and prompt a response.

Instructions:
Create a professional job application email (150-200 words max) that:
Subject Line: Create an attention-grabbing subject mentioning 'Application for [Job Title]' and candidate's key strength
Opening: Clearly state you're applying for the specific position and reference the job posting with the provided URL
Value Proposition: Highlight 2-3 most relevant qualifications from the resume that directly match the job requirements
Social Proof: Include one quantifiable achievement if available
Call to Action: Request an interview or conversation to discuss the opportunity
Professional Closing: Include resume, portfolio, and GitHub links naturally in the email body

Tone Requirements:
- Confident but not arrogant
- Specific, not generic
- Results-focused
- Professional yet personable

Output Format:
Return the response as a JSON object with exactly this structure:
{
"toEmail": "Pass through the recipient's email address from input",
"subject": "Compelling subject line here",
"body": "Complete email body with proper formatting, including resume, portfolio, and GitHub links with professional closing"
}

Key Rules:
- MUST clearly state this is a job application for the posted position
- MUST include the job posting URL in the email body for easy reference
- MUST mention you found the job posting on LinkedIn
- MUST include all three professional links naturally in the email body on separate lines:
  Resume: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RyNmI3YjCiacvPhRoqenr-YlL8Rgfs7y9gIA2jv5oQM/edit?tab=t.0
  Portfolio: https://eswarsaiportfolio.org/
  GitHub: https://github.com/ek-sai
- Never use phrases like 'I hope this email finds you well'
- Always lead with value and relevant qualifications
- Include specific metrics when possible
- Make all links contextual and professional, not awkward
- End with a request for interview/discussion opportunity
- CRITICAL: Return ONLY valid JSON format with "toEmail", "subject" and "body" keys
- Include candidate name 'Eswar Sai Korrapati' and professional closing within the body text
- Pass through the toEmail exactly as provided in input
- Format the professional links section as:
  "Please find my professional materials below:
  Resume: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RyNmI3YjCiacvPhRoqenr-YlL8Rgfs7y9gIA2jv5oQM/edit?tab=t.0
  Portfolio: https://eswarsaiportfolio.org/
  GitHub: https://github.com/ek-sai"

Inputs:
Company Name: {{ $('Parse').item.json.company }}
Job Title: {{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.title }}
Job Description: {{ $('Parse').item.json.jd }}
Candidate Resume Data: {{ $('resume').item.json.resume }}
Job Link:{{ $('Company Filter').item.json.link }}
toEmail: {{ $json.email }}

parameters.query: INSERT INTO applications (job_id, email_contact_id, subject, email_body, email_address) VALUES ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5)

options.queryReplacement: ={{ $('Get Job id').item.json.id }},{{ $json.id }},{{ JSON.parse($('Generate Email Structure').item.json.message.content).subject }},{{ JSON.parse($('Generate Email Structure').item.json.message.content).body }}, {{ JSON.parse($('Generate Email Structure').item.json.message.content).toEmail}}

parameters.query: UPDATE email_contacts SET contact_count = contact_count + 1, last_contacted = NOW() WHERE id = $1

SELECT 
  COALESCE(ec.id, NULL) as id,
  COALESCE(ec.email, $1) as email,
  COALESCE(ec.contact_count, 0) as contact_count,
  COALESCE(ec.last_contacted, NULL) as last_contacted,
  COALESCE(ec.response_count, 0) as response_count,
  CASE 
    WHEN ec.last_contacted IS NULL THEN 999::INTEGER 
    ELSE EXTRACT(DAY FROM NOW() - ec.last_contacted)::INTEGER 
  END as days_since_last_contact,
  CASE 
    WHEN ec.response_count > 0 THEN (ec.response_count::float / ec.contact_count) 
    ELSE 0 
  END as response_rate
FROM email_contacts ec 
WHERE ec.email = $1 AND ec.company_id = $2
UNION ALL
SELECT 
  NULL as id, 
  $1 as email, 
  0 as contact_count, 
  NULL as last_contacted, 
  0 as response_count, 
  999 as days_since_last_contact, 
  0 as response_rate
WHERE NOT EXISTS (
  SELECT 1 FROM email_contacts WHERE email = $1 AND company_id = $2
)
LIMIT 1;
INSERT INTO email_contacts (company_id, email, confidence_score, source) VALUES ($1, $2, $3, $4) ON CONFLICT (company_id, email) DO UPDATE SET confidence_score = $3 RETURNING id

SELECT id, company_id, title, location, job_url, match_score 
FROM jobs 
WHERE job_url = $1

SELECT id, email, contact_count, last_contacted, response_count, company_id
FROM email_contacts 
WHERE email = $1 AND company_id = $2
LIMIT 1;

// N8N Code Node: Company Domain Mapper
// Place this node BEFORE your Hunter.io HTTP Request node
// This will map company names to their correct domains

const companyToDomainMapping = {
  // FAANG + Big Tech
  'google': 'google.com',
  'alphabet': 'google.com',
  'meta': 'meta.com',
  'facebook': 'meta.com',
  'amazon': 'amazon.com',

  'jpmorgan': 'jpmorgan.com',
  'jp morgan': 'jpmorgan.com',
  'jpmorgan chase': 'jpmorgan.com',
  'jp morgan chase': 'jpmorgan.com',

  'morgan stanley': 'morganstanley.com',

  'fidelity': 'fidelity.com',
  'blackrock': 'blackrock.com',
  'vanguard': 'vanguard.com',
  'capital one': 'capitalone.com',
  'discover': 'discover.com',
  'ally': 'ally.com',
  'robinhood': 'robinhood.com',
  'coinbase': 'coinbase.com',

  // Consulting & Professional Services
  'mckinsey': 'mckinsey.com',
  'mckinsey & company': 'mckinsey.com',
  'bain': 'bain.com',
  'bain & company': 'bain.com',
  'boston consulting group': 'bcg.com',
  'bcg': 'bcg.com',
  'accenture': 'accenture.com',
  'deloitte': 'deloitte.com',
  'pwc': 'pwc.com',
  'pricewaterhousecoopers': 'pwc.com',
  'ernst & young': 'ey.com',
  'ey': 'ey.com',
  'kpmg': 'kpmg.com',

  // Healthcare & Pharma
  'johnson & johnson': 'jnj.com',
  'j&j': 'jnj.com',
  'pfizer': 'pfizer.com',
  'moderna': 'modernatx.com',
  'abbott': 'abbott.com',
  'medtronic': 'medtronic.com',
  'unitedhealth': 'unitedhealthgroup.com',
  'united health': 'unitedhealthgroup.com',
  'anthem': 'anthem.com',
  'aetna': 'aetna.com',
  'humana': 'humana.com',
  'cigna': 'cigna.com',

  // Retail & E-commerce
  'walmart': 'walmart.com',
  'target': 'target.com',
  'costco': 'costco.com',
  'home depot': 'homedepot.com',
  'lowes': 'lowes.com',
  'macys': 'macys.com',
  'nordstrom': 'nordstrom.com',
  'best buy': 'bestbuy.com',

  // Automotive
  'ford': 'ford.com',
  'general motors': 'gm.com',
  'gm': 'gm.com',
  'toyota': 'toyota.com',
  'honda': 'honda.com',
  'bmw': 'bmw.com',
  'mercedes': 'mercedes-benz.com',
  'mercedes-benz': 'mercedes-benz.com',
  'volkswagen': 'vw.com',
  'audi': 'audi.com',
  'porsche': 'porsche.com',
  'ferrari': 'ferrari.com',
  'lamborghini': 'lamborghini.com',

  // Airlines & Travel
  'delta': 'delta.com',
  'american airlines': 'aa.com',
  'united airlines': 'united.com',
  'southwest': 'southwest.com',
  'jetblue': 'jetblue.com',
  'expedia': 'expedia.com',
  'booking': 'booking.com',
  'marriott': 'marriott.com',
  'hilton': 'hilton.com',
  'hyatt': 'hyatt.com',

  // Media & Entertainment
  'disney': 'disney.com',
  'warner bros': 'warnerbros.com',
  'comcast': 'comcast.com',
  'verizon': 'verizon.com',
  'at&t': 'att.com',
  'att': 'att.com',
  'tmobile': 't-mobile.com',
  't-mobile': 't-mobile.com',
  'sprint': 't-mobile.com',

  // Energy & Utilities
  'exxonmobil': 'exxonmobil.com',
  'exxon': 'exxonmobil.com',
  'chevron': 'chevron.com',
  'shell': 'shell.com',
  'bp': 'bp.com',
  'conocophillips': 'conocophillips.com',

  // Startups & Unicorns
  'openai': 'openai.com',
  'anthropic': 'anthropic.com',
  'figma': 'figma.com',
  'notion': 'notion.so',
  'canva': 'canva.com',
  'airtable': 'airtable.com',
  'hubspot': 'hubspot.com',
  'mailchimp': 'mailchimp.com',
  'zendesk': 'zendesk.com',
  'twilio': 'twilio.com',
  'datadog': 'datadog.com',
  'okta': 'okta.com',
  'cloudflare': 'cloudflare.com',
  'mongodb': 'mongodb.com',
  'elastic': 'elastic.co',
  'hashicorp': 'hashicorp.com',
  'gitlab': 'gitlab.com',
  'github': 'github.com',
  'bitbucket': 'atlassian.com',
  'jira': 'atlassian.com',
  'confluence': 'atlassian.com',  // <-- Added missing comma here
  'arteraai': 'artera.ai'
};

// Get the company name from previous node
const inputCompany = $('Company Filter').item.json.company;

// Normalize the company name for matching
function normalizeCompanyName(name) {
  return name.toLowerCase()
    .replace(/[.,\/#!$%\^&\*;:{}=\-_`~()]/g, '') // Remove special chars
    .replace(/\s+/g, ' ') // Multiple spaces to single space
    .trim()
    .replace(/ inc$/i, '')
    .replace(/ llc$/i, '')
    .replace(/ ltd$/i, '')
    .replace(/ corp$/i, '')
    .replace(/ corporation$/i, '')
    .replace(/ company$/i, '')
    .replace(/ co$/i, '')
    .replace(/ & co$/i, '')
    .replace(/^the /i, '');
}

const normalizedCompany = normalizeCompanyName(inputCompany);

// Function to find domain
function findCompanyDomain(companyName) {
  const normalized = normalizeCompanyName(companyName);
  
  // Direct match
  if (companyToDomainMapping[normalized]) {
    return companyToDomainMapping[normalized];
  }
  
  // Partial match - check if any key contains the company name or vice versa
  for (const [key, domain] of Object.entries(companyToDomainMapping)) {
    if (normalized.includes(key) || key.includes(normalized)) {
      return domain;
    }
  }
  
  // Fallback strategies
  const cleanName = normalized.replace(/\s+/g, '');
  
  // Common domain patterns to try
  const possibleDomains = [
    `${cleanName}.com`,
    `${cleanName}.co`,
    `${cleanName}.net`,
    `${cleanName}.org`
  ];
  
  return possibleDomains[0]; // Default to .com
}

// Get the domain
const domain = findCompanyDomain(inputCompany);

// Construct the Hunter.io URL
const hunterUrl = `https://api.hunter.io/v2/domain-search?domain=${domain}&api_key={{ $env.HUNTER_API_KEY }}&department=hr`;

// Debug information
const debugInfo = {
  original_company: inputCompany,
  normalized_company: normalizedCompany,
  mapped_domain: domain,
  hunter_url: hunterUrl,
  mapping_source: companyToDomainMapping[normalizedCompany] ? 'direct_mapping' : 'fallback'
};

console.log('Domain Mapping Debug:', debugInfo);

// Return the data for the next node
return [{
  json: {
    company: inputCompany,
    domain: domain,
    hunter_url: hunterUrl,
    debug: debugInfo
  }
}];

// N8N Code Node: Company Domain Mapper
// Place this node BEFORE your Hunter.io HTTP Request node
// This will map company names to their correct domains

const companyToDomainMapping = {
  // FAANG + Big Tech
  'google': 'google.com',

// Get the company name from previous node
const inputCompany = $('Company Filter').item.json.company;

// Normalize the company name for matching
function normalizeCompanyName(name) {
  return name.toLowerCase()
    .replace(/[.,\/#!$%\^&\*;:{}=\-_`~()]/g, '') // Remove special chars
    .replace(/\s+/g, ' ') // Multiple spaces to single space
    .trim()
    .replace(/ inc$/i, '')
    .replace(/ llc$/i, '')
    .replace(/ ltd$/i, '')
    .replace(/ corp$/i, '')
    .replace(/ corporation$/i, '')
    .replace(/ company$/i, '')
    .replace(/ co$/i, '')
    .replace(/ & co$/i, '')
    .replace(/^the /i, '');
}

const normalizedCompany = normalizeCompanyName(inputCompany);

// Function to find domain
function findCompanyDomain(companyName) {
  const normalized = normalizeCompanyName(companyName);
  
  // Direct match
  if (companyToDomainMapping[normalized]) {
    return companyToDomainMapping[normalized];
  }
  
  // Partial match - check if any key contains the company name or vice versa
  for (const [key, domain] of Object.entries(companyToDomainMapping)) {
    if (normalized.includes(key) || key.includes(normalized)) {
      return domain;
    }
  }
  
  // Fallback strategies
  const cleanName = normalized.replace(/\s+/g, '');
  
  // Common domain patterns to try
  const possibleDomains = [
    `${cleanName}.com`,
    `${cleanName}.co`,
    `${cleanName}.net`,
    `${cleanName}.org`
  ];
  
  return possibleDomains[0]; // Default to .com
}

// Get the domain
const domain = findCompanyDomain(inputCompany);

// Construct the Hunter.io URL
const hunterUrl = `https://api.hunter.io/v2/domain-search?domain=${domain}&api_key={{ $env.HUNTER_API_KEY }}`;

// Debug information
const debugInfo = {
  original_company: inputCompany,
  normalized_company: normalizedCompany,
  mapped_domain: domain,
  hunter_url: hunterUrl,
  mapping_source: companyToDomainMapping[normalizedCompany] ? 'direct_mapping' : 'fallback'
};

console.log('Domain Mapping Debug:', debugInfo);

// Return the data for the next node
return [{
  json: {
    company: inputCompany,
    domain: domain,
    hunter_url: hunterUrl,
    debug: debugInfo
  }
}];
